availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Leonidas Denny (Harrodsburg, Mercer County, Kentucky, farm hand and lieutenant)

body.p: Harrodsburg, Mercer County, Kentucky, farm hand and lieutenant. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah T. Campbell Denny. Son of Walter Denny and Eliza J. Denny. Farm hand in Mercer County in 1860. Enrolled in 20th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.). Promoted from Corporal to Sergeant on March 26, 1862. Promoted to 1st Sergeant on November 24, 1862. Promoted to 1st Lieutenant on April 1, 1863. Dismissed from service on February 9, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrodsburg, p. 46.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall, Marshall, p. 44.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 40.
Find A Grave, "L. Denny(1840-Death)," Memorial #35958329, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35958329 (accessed January 17, 2019).
